<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Economic uncertainty may reduce patient demand for knee or other joint replacement procedures.&nbsp;&nbsp;If there is not sufficient patient demand for the procedures for which orthopedic implant products are used, customer demand for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	orthopedic implant compon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ents would likely drop, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	business, financial condition and results of operations could be harmed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The orthopedics industry in which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	customers operate is vulnerable to economic trends. Joint replacement procedures are elective procedures, the cost of which may not be fully covered by or reimbursable through government, including Medicare or Medicaid, or private health insurance. In times of economic uncertainty or recession, individuals may reduce the amount of money that they spend on deferrable medical procedures, including joint replacement procedures.&nbsp;&nbsp;Economic downturns in the United States and international markets could have an adverse effect on demand for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	orthopedic implant components.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Failure to comply with Quality System Regulations or industry standards could result in a material adverse effect on the Company's business and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company's Quality Management System complies with the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	requirements of ISO 13485:2003 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ISO 9001:2008. In addition the Company has registered its manufacturing facilities under ITAR and with the FDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	not able to comply with the Quality Management System or industry-defined standards, it may not be able to fill customer orders to the satisfaction of its customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Failure to produce products compliant with these standards could lead to a loss of customers which would have an adverse impact on the Company's business and results of operations. Violations of the ITAR, FDA and other regulations may subject the Company to significant fines or penalties, which could have an adverse impact on the Company&#x2019;s results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	If trade secrets are not kept confidential, the secrets may be used by others to compete against the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company relies on trade secrets to protect its proprietary processes and there are no assurances that others will not independently develop or acquire substantially equivalent technologies or otherwise gain access to the proprietary process.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he meaningful protection of such proprietary technology cannot be guaranteed.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company relies on confidentiality agreements with its employees.&nbsp;&nbsp;Remedies for any breach by a party to these confidentiality agreements may not be adequate to prevent such actions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Failure to maintain trade secret protection, for any reason, could have a material adverse effect on the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The Company is subject to stringent environmental regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company's manufacturing operations are subject to a variety of federal, state and local requirements governing the protection of the environment.&nbsp;&nbsp;These environmental regulations include those related to the use, storage, handling, discharge and disposal of toxic or otherwise hazardous materials used in or resulting from the Company's manufacturing processes.&nbsp;&nbsp;Failure to comply with environmental laws could subject the Company to substantial liability or force the Company to significantly change its manufacturing operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, under some of these laws and regulations, the Company could be held financially responsible for remedial measures if its properties are contaminated, even if it did not cause the contamination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	A product liability suit could adversely affect the Company's operating results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The testing, manufacturing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, marketing and sale of the customer's and Company's medical devices and/or components, including orthopedic implants, as well as components for the military and law enforcement industry, entail the inherent risk of liability claims or product recalls. If the Company's customers are involved in a lawsuit, it is possible that the Company would also be named.&nbsp;&nbsp;Although the Company maintains product liability insurance, coverage may not be adequate. Product liability insurance is expensive, and in the future may not be available on acceptable terms, if at all. In addition, the Company may incur significant legal expenses and damage to the Company&#x2019;s reputation in the event of any such claim regardless of whether the Company is found to be liable. A successful product liability claim or product recall could have a material adverse effect on the business, financial condition, and ability to market the Company's products and services in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	The market price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock is volatile.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The market price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock has in the past been, and may in the future continue to be, volatile.&nbsp;&nbsp;A variety of events may cause the market price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock to fluctuate significantly, including, but not limited to, quarter to quarter variations in operating results, adverse or positive news reports or public announcements and market conditions within the Company&#x2019;s industry.&nbsp;&nbsp;Due to the relatively small public float for the Company&#x2019;s common stock, trading of such shares may have a disproportionate effect on the stock price.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the stock market in recent years has experienced significant price and volume fluctuations. This volatility has had a substantial effect on the market prices of companies, at times for reasons unrelated to their operating performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;Trading in the Company&#x2019;s stock or market fluctuations may adversely affect the price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The Compan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	y may seek to make
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	acquisitions of companies, products or technologies that may disrupt the business and divert management&#x2019;s attention, cause the Comp
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	any to incur additional costs,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	debt or issue equity securities and adversely impact its results of operations and financial condition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company may seek to make or make acquisitions of complementary companies, products or technologies from time to time.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any acquisitions will require the assimilation of the operations, products and personnel of the acquired businesses and the training and motivation of these individuals. Further, such activities may divert management's attention and could result in an inability to realize the expected benefits, savings or synergies from the acquisition, the loss of key personnel of the acquired company, and exposure to unexpected liabilities of the acquired company. The Company also may have to, or choose to, incur additional costs, incur debt or issue equity securities to pay for any future acquisitions and its working capital needs.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such financing may not be available to the Company or may be on terms that involve covenants and financial ratios that may restrict the Company's ability to operate its business. The issuance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	common stock, preferred stock or other equity se
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	curities in connection with an acquired business could be substantially dilutive to the stockholders&#x2019; holdings.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company cannot give any assurance that any such acquisitions will become profitable or remain so or will not have a material unfavorable impact on it. &nbsp;The Company is not currently party to any agreements, written or oral, for the acquisition of any company, product or technology.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	could be negatively affected as a result of the actions of activist or hostile stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	could be negatively affected as a result of shareholder activism, which could cause the Company to incur significant expense, hinder execution of its business strategy and impact the trading value of the Company&#x2019;s securities. Shareholder activism, which could take many forms or arise in a variety of situations, has been increasing in publicly traded companies in recent years.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is subject to the risks associated with such activism in light of the fact that a shareholder filed a Schedule 13D in November 2015 expressing an intent to engage in substantive discussions with management, the Board of Directors and others relating to the Company&#x2019;s operations, its management, strategy and other matters. Shareholder activism, including potential proxy contests, requires significant time and attention by management and the Board of Directors, potentially interfering with the Company&#x2019;s ability to execute its strategic plan. Additionally, such shareholder activism could give rise to perceived uncertainties as to the Company&#x2019;s future direction, adversely affect its relationships with key executives, customers and other business partners,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	make it more difficult to attract and retain qualified personnel. Also, the Company may be required to incur significant legal fees and other expenses related to activist shareholder matters. Any of these impacts could materially and adversely affect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and operating results. Further, the market price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock could be subject to significant fluctuation or otherwise be adversely affected by the events, risks and uncertainties described in this discussed in this &#x201C;Risk Factors&#x201D; section.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company may be exposed to potential risks relating to internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As required by Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (&#x201C;SOX&#x201D;), the SEC adopted rules requiring public companies to include a report of management on the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting in their annual reports, including Form 10-K.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, if a reporting company is an accelerated filer or a large accelerated filer (as defined by the Exchange Act), the independent registered public accounting firm auditing a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	reporting C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompany&#x2019;s financial statements must also attest to and report on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	reporting company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	internal control over financial reporting as well as the operating effectiveness of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	reporting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	company&#x2019;s internal control.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company was only subject to the management evaluation and review portion of these requirements for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Company's failure to satisfy the requirements of Section 404 of SOX on an ongoing, timely basis could result in the loss of investor confidence in the reliability of our financial statements, which in turn could harm our business and negatively impact the trading price of our common stock. In addition, any failure to implement required new or improved controls, or difficulties encountered in their implementation, could harm our operating results or cause us to fail to meet our reporting obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Failure to comply with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	the listing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	requirements of the NYSE MKT could lead to the commencement of delisting proceedings in accordance the NYSE MKT&#x2019;s Company Guide. Delisting could limit investors' ability to effect transactions in the Company's securities and subject the stock to additional trading restrictions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s common stock is listed on the NYSE MKT, a national securities exchange, or the Exchange. To maintain such listing, the Company is required to meet the continued listing requirements of the Exchange as set forth in its Company Guide. If the Company is unable to maintain the listing of its stock on the NYSE MKT or another exchange for failure to comply with the continued listing requirements, including timely filing of Exchange Act reports and compliance with the Exchange's corporate governance requirements, the Company and its security holders could face significant material adverse consequences including a limited availability of market quotations for its stock and a decreased ability to issue additional securities or obtain additional financing in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RISK_FACTORS>

<EFX_PROPERTIES>
<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Ite
</FONT>
<A NAME="HRT-20151231X10K_HTM_PROPERTIES">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	m 2. PROPERTIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The manufacturing facilities and offices of the Company are located in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	buildings in an industrial area in Fitchburg, Massachusetts. The first building consists of an approximately 22,000 square foot, six story building. The second building is over 94,000 square feet.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, the Company owns two unoccupied buildings in the complex with a total of approximate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ly 52,000 square feet.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company entered into an agreement in January 2016 for the sale of the two unoccupied buildings and land. The closing is subject to permitting and approvals from the City of Fitchburg and the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and is expected to close by the end of 2016.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company believes its current facilities are sufficient to meet current and future production needs through the fiscal year ending
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Net Sales
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company's consolidated net sales for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$21,495,184
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2,575,108
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, from net sales of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$24,070,292
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in net sales was due to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in net sales of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	sensors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as well as a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	11.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in net sales of orthopedic implant components
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, partially offset by a 7.9% increase in net sales of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	custom thermoplastic injection
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	molding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The decrease in net sensor sales was due to decreased volume of 10.9% due in part to reduced order volume from one of the Company&#x2019;s largest customers in 2014. In addition, silver surcharge billed decreased 29.9% due to the decrease in volume as well as a 17.7% decrease in the weighted average price of silver for the full year 2015, as compared to 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Net sales of orthopedic implant components were down as a result of decreased orders from the Company's third largest customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The decreases are partially offset by the Company&#x2019;s growth in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	custom thermoplastic injection
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	molding
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the automotive industry as a result of an increase in sales volume from the Company&#x2019;s second largest customer when compared to full year 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Gross Profit
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Gross profit de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	creased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$1,475,213
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$4,638,051
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$3,162,838
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Gross profi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	t as a percentage of net sales de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	creased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	4.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	points, from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	19.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	14.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in gross profit was due primarily to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	declining sales as a result of decreased order volumes in sensors and orthopedic implant components, as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	well as declining silver prices and increased expenditures in the Company&#x2019;s quality functions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Orthopedic implant components gross profit as a percentage of sales decreased 8.6 points, when compared to 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decrease in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	gross profit from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	orthopedic implant components is a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	decreased orders from the Company&#x2019;s third largest
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	customer and the related
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	product mix

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Gross profit was also impacted by increased labor costs as a result of production issues in the first quarter of 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	While net sales of sensors decreased due to lower volumes and a decrease in the weighted average price of silver, g
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ross profit as a percentage of net sales increased by 0.7 points for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, as compared to the prior year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	due primarily to cost efficiencies and negotiated price reduction
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in raw mater
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ials.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Gross profit as a percentage of net sales in the Company's custom thermoplastic injection molding also experienced modest margin improvement due primarily to investments in automation for some of the Company's customers in the automotive industry. These margin improvements were partially offset by lower margins in tooling, net of deferrals, and other costs of sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;

	Ot
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	her cost of sales for the year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 reflects
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	support functions such as quality, engineering, tooling maintenance and material handling. Net other cost of sales as a percentage of net sales expanded to 10.2% in 2015 as compared to 7.6% in 2014. The increase is primarily due to increased expenditures of $367,664 in the Company's manufacturing quality function to support
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Company&#x2019;s process and capital equipment validations as part of the long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	term growth strategy in our component manufacturing of machined and plastic
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	parts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other Income (Expense)

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	in

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015

	compared to

	$227,954
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014

	, a
</FONT>

	n

	increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$42,558
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>

	Interest expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$260,300
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015

	in expenses related to the assets held for sale at December 31, 2015, partially offset by a net gain on fixed asset sales of $17,143.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, in 2014, the Company recorded other income of $23,423 as a result of a refund of the remaining portion of the performance guarantee obligation of ART on behalf of RMDDx.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income Tax Provision
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The tax provisions for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 are attributable to the U.S. federal and state income taxes on our continuing operations. The Company&#x2019;s combined federal and state effective income tax rate from continuing operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was 0.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4, respectively, due to the impact of deferred tax assets reserved for with a valuation allowance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Loss)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	from Discontinued Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On May 8, 2014, RMDDxUSA filed a voluntary petition for relief under Chapter 7 (Liquidation) of the United States Bankruptcy Code in the District of Massachusetts. A trustee was assigned to review the assets and liabilities of the company. At December 31, 2014, there were no assets and $320,056 of liabilities remaining on the balance sheet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On March 20, 2015, the Chapter 7 discharge order was issued by the assigned trustee and the case was closed. For 2015, net income of $362,610 was recorded from discontinued operations as a result of the write off of the remaining liabilities of $320,056 and the reversal of other comprehensive income of $42,502 from cumulative translation adjustments from RMDDx Corporation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Net loss from discontinued operations for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	was $1,779
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	and consisted primarily of legal and other fees incurred offset by minor reversals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Earnings Per Share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated basic and diluted loss per share for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended December 31, 2015 was $0.15 per share as compared
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to basic and diluted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	earnings of $0.24 and $0.23 per share, respectively for 2014, a decrease of $0.39 and $0.38, respectively. The decrease in earnings per share is due largely to the decrease in gross profit of orthopedic implant components and sensors, increased quality costs as well as the lack of net sales of Predictor licenses in the 2015 versus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$250,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;These decreases were partially offset by the impact of other income from discontinued operations as a result of the final discharge order
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to the bankruptcy of RMDDxUSA and reduced operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In 2014, the Company entered into two operating leases for office equipment. Lease expense under all operating leases was approximately $7,288 and $4,812 for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Workin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	g capital was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$2,509,588
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$1,308,472
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at year-end
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, a net increase of $1,201,116.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The increase is due primarily to the reclassification of $2,071,495 related to the revolver from current liabilities to long-term liabilities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, the subordinated promissory notes of $473,135 were reclassified from long-term liabilities to current liabilities in 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	When excluding the impact of the reclassification of the revolver and the subordinated promissory notes, working capital decreased $397,244.&nbsp;&nbsp;The remaining decrease in working capital was due largely to decreases in accounts receivable and inventory, partially offset by decreases in accounts payable and accrued expenses.
</FONT>
</P>

	2015

	, capital expenditures for machinery and equipment for the manufacture of orthopedic implants totaled $738,731 as compared to $245,928 in 2014. Additionally, in 2015, machinery and equipment related to custom molding and sensors were $114,923 and $542,821, respectively. Lastly, in 2015 and 2014,
</FONT>

	tooling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to sensors were $195,102 and $208,215, respectively.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	At December 31, 2015 the Company&#x2019;s total debt was $4,031,767 as compared to $4,338,043 at December 31, 2014, a decrease of $306,276 or 7.1%.&nbsp; The balance at December 31, 2015 was comprised of outstanding principal amounts of $1,710,287 of term debt, $1,511,495 on a revolving line of credit, $336,850 on an equipment line of credit and $473,135 of subordinated promissory notes as discussed in more detail below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has a multi-year credit facility with a Massachusetts based bank.&nbsp;&nbsp;The credit facility includes a revolving line of credit (the "revolver"), commercial term loan, two equipment term loans and an equipment line of credit as detailed below.&nbsp;&nbsp;The debt is secured by substantially all assets of the Company with the exception of real property.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The revolver provides for borrowings up to 80% of eligible accounts receivable and 50% of eligible raw materials inventory.&nbsp; The interest rate on the revolver is calculated at the bank's prime rate plus 0.25% (3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5% at December&nbsp;31, 2015). The revolver has a maturity date of June 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Amounts available to borrow under the revolver are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$917,830
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The commercial term loan has a five year term with a maturity date of March 2018. The interest rate on the loan is a fixed 4.25% per annum and the loan requires monthly payments of principal and interest of approximately $28,000.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The outstanding balance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	on the commercial term loan at December 31, 2015 was $714,175.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In 2013, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he Company had an equipment line of credit which allowed for advances of up to $1.0 million and included a one-year draw period during which payments were interest only. The draw period ended March 29, 2014 and the then outstanding balance on the equipment line of credit of $740,999 was converted to a five-year term loan with a maturity date of March 29, 2019 with monthly payments consisting of principal and interest at a fixed rate of 4.65%. The outstanding balance of the equipment term loan at December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was $50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1,281
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In 2014, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company entered into an equipment line of credit that allowed for advances of up to $1.0 million under the multi-year credit facility and included a one-year draw period during which payments were interest only. The draw period ended June 26, 2015 and the then outstanding balance on the equipment line of credit of $415,785 was converted to an equipment term loan with a five-year term, maturing on of June 26, 2020. The equipment term loan requires monthly payments of approximately $8,000, consisting of principal and interest at a fixed rate of 4.67%.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The outstanding balance of the equipment term loan at December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was $378,617.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On June 19, 2015, the Company entered into a new equipment line of credit for $1.0 million under the Company's multi-year credit facility. At December 31, 2015, $336,850 has been drawn on the new equipment line of credit. The term of this equipment line of credit is six years, maturing on June 19, 2021, inclusive of a maximum one-year draw period. Repayment shall consist of monthly interest only payments, equal to the bank's prime rate plus 0.25% as to each advance commencing on the date of the loan through the earlier of: (i) one year from the date of the loan or (ii) the date upon which the equipment line of credit is fully advanced (the &#x201C;Conversion Date&#x201D;). On the Conversion Date, principal and interest payments will be due and payable monthly in an amount sufficient to pay the loan in full based upon an amortization schedule commensurate with the remaining term of the loan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The bank facility contains both financial and non-financial covenants. The financial covenants include maintaining certain debt coverage and leverage ratios. The non-financial covenants relate to various matters including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	receiving bank approval prior to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	executing further borrowings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	security interests, mergers or consolidations, acquisitions, guarantees, sales of assets other than in the normal course of business, leasing, changes in ownership and payment of dividends.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company was in compliance with all bank covenants as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In January 2013, the Company entered into two equipment notes totaling $272,500 with a financing company to acquire production equipment. The notes bear interest at 4.66% and require monthly payments of principal and interest totaling approximately $5,000 over the term of five years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The outstanding balance of these equipment notes at December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $116,214.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In December 2013, the Company completed a private offering in which the Company sold an aggregate of $500,000 in subordinated promissory notes. The notes are unsecured and require quarterly interest-only payments at a rate of 10% per annum. On the second anniversary following issuance, the interest rate increased to 12% per annum. The notes mature in December 2016 at which point the outstanding balance is due in full. The subordinated promissory notes may be prepaid by the Company at any time following the first anniversary thereof without penalty. The notes are subordinated to all indebtedness of the Company pursuant to its multi-year bank credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with the subordinated promissory notes, the Company issued 100,000 warrants to purchase the Company's common stock. In 2014, the Company received proceeds of $105,300 from the exercise of 30,000 warrants. The warrants are exercisable through December 2016 at an exercise price of $3.51 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;None of the warrants were exercised in 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;A total of 70,000 warrants remain unexercised at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	No dividends were declared or paid in 2015 or 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company believes that cash flows from its operations, together with its existing working capital, the revolving line of credit and other resources, will be sufficient to fund operations at current levels and repay the next twelve months of debt obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
