<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Amortization expense related to intangible assets, excluding the above noted impairment charge, was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$3,235
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$3,974
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in 2015 and 2014, respectively. Estimated future annual amortization expense for currently amortizing intangible assets is expected to approximate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1,756
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes deferred tax liabilities and assets for the expected future tax consequences of events that have been included in the financial statements or tax returns. Under this method, deferred tax liabilities and assets are determined based on the difference between the financial statement and tax bases of assets and liabilities using tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company follows the provisions of FASB ASC 740, &#x201C;Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes&#x2014;An Interpretation of FASB No.&nbsp;109.&#x201D; FASB ASC 740 provides detailed guidance for the financial statement recognition, measurement and disclosure of uncertain tax positions recognized in the financial statements in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;109. Tax positions must meet a &#x201C;more-likely-than-not&#x201D; recognition threshold at the effective date to be recognized upon the adoption of FASB ASC 740 and in subsequent periods.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	interest and penalties related to uncertain tax positions were accrued at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primary operations are located in the US. Tax years ended December&nbsp;31, 2012 or later remain subject to examination by the IRS and state
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	taxing authori
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Share-based compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Share-based compensation cost is measured at the grant date, based on the fair value of the award, and is recognized as an expense over the employee&#x2019;s requisite service period (generally the vesting period of the share-based grant).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Comprehensive income
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In 2015 and 2014, the Company has accumulated other comprehensive income of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

	of

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Earnings per share data
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Basic earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) available to common shareholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding.&nbsp;&nbsp;The computation of diluted earnings (loss) per share is similar to the computation of basic earnings (loss) per share except that the denominator is increased to include the average number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the dilutive potential common shares had been issued.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the numerator is adjusted for any changes in net income (loss) that would result from the assumed conversions of those potential shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	11
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#HRT-20151231X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Arrhythmia Research Technology, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to&nbsp;Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Research and development
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Research and development expenses include costs directly attributable to conducting research and development programs primarily related to the development of a unique process to improve silver coating during the manufacturing processes, including the design and testing of specific process improvements for certain medical device components. Such costs include salaries, payroll taxes, employee benefit costs, materials, supplies, depreciation on research equipment, and services provided by outside contractors.&nbsp;&nbsp;All costs associated with research and development programs are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In the normal course of business, management evaluates all new accounting pronouncements issued by the FASB, SEC, Emerging Issues Task Force (&#x201C;EITF&#x201D;), or other authoritative accounting bodies to determine the potential impact they may have on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Financial Statements. Based upon this review, except as noted below,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	management does not expect any of the recently issued accounting pronouncements, which have not already been adopted, to have a material impact on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-02, &#x201C;Leases (Topic 842),&#x201D; which requires companies to recognize all leases as assets and liabilities on the consolidated balance sheet. This ASU retains a distinction between finance leases and operating leases, and the classification criteria for distinguishing between finance leases and operating leases are substantially similar to the classification criteria for distinguishing between capital leases and operating leases in the current accounting literature. The result of retaining a distinction between finance leases and operating leases is that under the lessee accounting model in Topic 842, the effect of leases in a consolidated statement of comprehensive income and a consolidated statement of cash flows is largely unchanged from previous GAAP. &nbsp;The amendments in this ASU are effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2018, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Earlier application is permitted.&nbsp;The Company is currently evaluating the impact that the adoption of this ASU will have on its Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In July 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-11, &#x201C;Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory,&#x201D; which simplifies the subsequent measurement of inventory by requiring inventory to be measured at the lower of cost and net realizable value. Net realizable value is the estimated selling prices in the ordinary course of business, less reasonably predictable costs of completion, disposal, and transportation. This ASU is effective for public business entities for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2016, and interim periods within those fiscal years.&nbsp;The Company is currently assessing the impact of adopting this ASU on its Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In May 2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2014-09, &#x201C;Revenue from Contracts with Customers.&#x201D; The core principle behind ASU No.&nbsp;2014-09 is that an entity should recognize revenue in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for delivering goods and services. This model involves a five-step process that includes identifying the contract with the customer, identifying the performance obligations in the contract, determining the transaction price, allocating the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract and recognizing revenue when the entity satisfies the performance obligations. This ASU allows two methods of adoption; a full retrospective approach where historical financial information is presented in accordance with the new standard, and a modified retrospective approach where this ASU is applied to the most current period presented in the financial statements. In August 2015, the FASB issued ASU No 2015-14 &#x201C;Revenue from Contracts with Customers: Deferral of the Effective Date,&#x201D; which deferred the effective date of ASU 2014-09 to annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2017, with earlier application permitted as of annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016. The Company is currently assessing the financial impact of adopting ASU 2014-09 and the methods of adoption; however, given the scope of the new standard, the Company is currently unable to provide a reasonable estimate regarding the financial impact or which method of adoption will be elected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In April 2014, the FASB issued ASU No. 2014-08, &#x201C;Reporting Discontinued Operations and Disclosures of Disposals of Components of an Entity,&#x201D; which amends the definition of a discontinued operation and requires entities to provide additional disclosures about disposal transactions that do not meet the discontinued operations criteria. The revised ASU changes how entities identify and disclose information about disposal transactions under U.S. GAAP. This ASU is effective prospectively for all disposals (except disposals classified as held for sale before the adoption date) or components initially classified as held for sale in periods beginning on or after December 15, 2014. This ASU is applicable for disposal transactions, if any, that the Company enters into after January 2, 2015. This ASU did not materially impact the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Reclassification of prior period balances
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Amounts in prior year financial statements are reclassified when necessary to conform to the current year presentation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	cost of silver in our inventory as raw materials, in work-in-process or as a plated surface on finished goods had an estimated cost of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$313,738
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$439,800
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>

	For the year ended

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31,

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015

	, the Company recorded

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1,461,353
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of depreciation expense compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1,471,832
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. There are no commitments related to the completion of construction in process as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On December 4, 2015, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	entered into a Letter of Intent to sell the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	unoccupied buildings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with a total of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	52,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	square feet
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and land, at its Fitchburg, Massachusetts campus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Subsequently, on January 13, 2016, the Company entered into a Purchase and Sale Agreement for these buildings.&nbsp;&nbsp;As t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	hese buildings are under agreement to be sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, they have been classified as Assets H
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eld for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ale
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;The carrying value of the properties ($665,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	) approximated the fair value less the cost to sell.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company expects the sale of the properties to be completed by the end of 2016 and does not expected any material impact on the statement of operations.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Bank Debt
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The revolving line of credit (the "revolver"), commercial term loan, two equipment term loans and an equipment line of credit are all under the terms of a multi-year credit facility with a bank as detailed below.&nbsp;&nbsp;The debt is secured by substantially all assets of the Company with the exception of real property.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revolver
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The revolver provides for borrowings up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	80%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of eligible accounts receivable and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of eligible raw materials inventory.&nbsp; The interest rate on the revolver is calculated at the bank's prime rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	). The revolver has a maturity date of June 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Amounts available to borrow under the revolver are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	917,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	830
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Commercial term loan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The commercial term loan has a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year term with a maturity date of March 2018. The interest rate on the loan is a fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per annum and the loan requires monthly payments of principal and interest of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$28,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Equipment line of credit and equipment term loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	s
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On March 29, 2013, the Company entered into an equipment line of credit that allowed for advances of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million and included a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-year draw period during which payments were interest only. The draw period ended March 29, 2014 and the then outstanding balance on the equipment line of credit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$740,999
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was converted to an equipment term loan with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-year term, maturing on of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	March 29, 2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The equipment term loan requires monthly payments of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$14,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, consisting of principal and interest at a fixed rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.65%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On June 26, 2014, the Company entered into an equipment line of credit that allowed for advances of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million and included a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-year draw period during which payments were interest only. The draw period ended June 26, 2015 and the then outstanding balance on the equipment line of credit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$415,785
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was converted to an equipment term loan with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-year term, maturing on of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	June 26, 2020
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The equipment term loan requires monthly payments of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$8,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, consisting of principal and interest at a fixed rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.67%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On June 19, 2015, the Company entered into a new equipment line of credit for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million under the Company's multi-year credit facility. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company has drawn
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$336,850
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	on the new equipment line of credit. The term of this equipment line of credit is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years, maturing on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	June 19, 2021
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, inclusive of a maximum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-year draw period. Repayment shall consist of monthly interest only payments, equal to the bank's prime rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as to each advance commencing on the date of the loan through the earlier of: (i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year from the date of the loan or (ii) the date upon which the equipment line of credit is fully advanced (the &#x201C;Conversion Date&#x201D;). On the Conversion Date, principal and interest payments will be due and payable monthly in an amount sufficient to pay the loan in full based upon an amortization schedule commensurate with the remaining term of the loan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Arrhythmia Research Technology, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to&nbsp;Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Bank covenants
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The bank facility contains both financial and non-financial covenants. The financial covenants include maintaining certain debt coverage and leverage ratios. The non-financial covenants relate to various matters including notice prior to executing further borrowings and security interests, mergers or consolidations, acquisitions, guarantees, sales of assets other than in the normal course of business, leasing, changes in ownership and payment of dividends. The Company was in compliance with all bank covenants as of December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Other debt
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Equipment notes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In January 2013, the Company entered into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	equipment notes totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$272,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with a financing company to acquire production equipment. The notes bear interest at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.66%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and require monthly payments of principal and interest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	over the term of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Subordinated promissory notes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In December 2013, the Company completed a private offering in which the Company sold an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in subordinated promissory notes. The notes are unsecured and require
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	quarterly interest-only payments at a rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per annum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the first two years, increasing to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per annum in December 2015.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The notes mature in December 2016 at which point the outstanding balance is due in full. The subordinated promissory notes may be prepaid by the Company at any time following the first anniversary thereof without penalty. The notes are subordinated to all indebtedness of the Company pursuant to its March 2013 multi-year bank credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with the subordinated promissory notes, the Company issued warrants to purchase the Company's common stock (see Note 9). In order to account for the subordinated notes payable and warrants, the Company allocated the proceeds between the notes and warrants on a relative fair value basis. As a result, the Company allocated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$416,950
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to the notes and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$83,050
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to the warrants. The total discount on the notes is being recognized as non-cash interest expense over the term of the notes. In the years ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$27,683
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of non-cash interest expense related to the amortization of the discount. The unamortized discount which is net against the outstanding balance of the subordinated promissory notes is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$26,865
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Future maturities of debt for the years ending December 31 are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In assessing the realizability of deferred tax assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all deferred tax assets will not be realized. The ultimate realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income during the periods in which those temporary differences become deductible. Management considers the scheduled reversal of deferred tax liabilities, projected future taxable income, and tax-planning strategies in making this asse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ssment. As of December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the company continues to maintain a valuation allowance against all of its domestic and foreign deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	y has federal and state

	7.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employee Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company sponsors an Employee Savings and Investment Plan under Section 401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code covering all eligible employees of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Employees can contribute up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	90%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of their eligible compensation to the maximum allowable by the IRS.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s matching contributions are at the discretion of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s matching contributions in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$47,858
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$46,958
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectiv
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ely.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with the subordinated promissory notes issued in December 2013 (see Note 5), the Company issued warrants to purchase

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	100,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of the Company&#x2019;s common stock. The warrants are exercisable during the period commencing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	months after issuance and for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years from issuance, at an exercise price equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$3.51
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share, namely, the closing market price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock on the day prior to the closing date of the offering. The warrants expire in December 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During 2015, there were no warrants exercised.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During 2014, the Company received proceeds of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$105,300
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from the exercise
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of 30,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	70,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	warrants remain unexercised.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Arrhythmia Research Technology, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to&nbsp;Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock options and Share-Based Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In March 2010, the Company's Board of Directors adopted the Arrhythmia Research Technology, Inc. 2010 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#x201C;2010 Plan&#x201D;). The 2010 Plan authorizes the issuance of an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares. The Company's 2001 Stock Option Plan (the "2001 Plan"), which expired in 2011, will continue to govern outstanding options but no further options will be granted under the 2001 Plan. The Company now has one plan providing the Company flexibility to award a mix of stock options, equity incentive grants, performance awards and other types of stock-based compensation to certain eligible employees, non-employee directors, or consultants and under which an aggregate of 500,000 shares have been reserved for such grants. The options granted have either
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year contractual terms that vest annually over a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-year term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	At December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	options to acquire a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	184,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	outstanding;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	15,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from the 2001 Plan and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	169,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the 2010 Plan. At December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	318,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares available fo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r future grants
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	under the 2010 Plan, after giving effect to shares which became available for reissuance due to expired or forfeited options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The fair value of each stock option award is estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model that uses the assumptions noted in the following table. Expected volatilities are based on historical volatility of the Common Stock using historical periods consistent with the expected term of the options. The expected term of options granted under the Company&#x2019;s equity incentive plan, all of which qualify as &#x201C;plain vanilla,&#x201D; is based on the average of the contractual term and the vesting period as permitted under SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin Nos. 107 and 110. The risk-free rate is based on the yield of a U.S. Treasury security with a term consistent with the option.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	62,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	new option grants, respectively. The assumptions used to measure the fair value of option grants in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">

	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The total intrinsic value of options exercised during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015 and 2014 were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$60,197
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$80,800
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, share-based compensation expense related to stock options and the non-cash issuance of common stock amounted to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$29,178
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$33,390
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively, and is included in general and administrative expenses. As of December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, there was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$134,160
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$86,896
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of unrecognized compensation costs, respectively, related to non-vested share-based compensation arrangements granted under the stock option plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;This cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years. The weighted average grant date fair value of options issued in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.66
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Arrhythmia Research Technology, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to&nbsp;Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	10.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Earnings per share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Basic earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) available to common shareholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding.&nbsp;&nbsp;The computation of diluted earnings (loss) per share is similar to the computation of basic earnings (loss) per share except that the denominator is increased to include the average number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the dilutive potential common shares had been issued.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the numerator is adjusted for any changes in net income (loss) that would result from the assumed conversions of those potential shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	there were options to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	184,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares and warrants to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	70,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of the Company's common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	outstanding, all of which were anti-dilutive. Therefore,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	none
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of these options or warrants were included in the calculation of loss per share in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	there were options to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	165,800
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares and warrants to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	70,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of the Company's common stock outstanding. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	47,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the options to purchase, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	none
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the warrants, were anti-dilutive and therefore not included in the calculation of earnings per share in 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s Chief Operating and Decision Maker ("CODM") manages the operations and reviews the results of operations as a single reporting unit. While the Company operates its business as one segment, the Company has diversified manufacturing capabilities as evidenced by its product offerings across several industry categories support
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ing customers around the globe.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	12.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Discontinued Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company's subsidiary, RMDDxUSA Corp. and its Prince Edward Island subsidiary RMDDx Corporation (collectively "WirelessDx"), discontinued operations 2012, filed for relief under Chapter 7 (Liquidation) of the United States Bankruptcy Code in 2014 and on March 20, 2015, the Chapter 7 Order was formally discharged and the case was closed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	net income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$362,610
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was recorded from discontinued operations as a result of the write-off of the remaining liabilities of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$320,056
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the reversal of accumulated other comprehensive income of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$42,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	553
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from cumulative translation adjustments from RMDDx Corporation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Arrhythmia Research Technology, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to&nbsp;Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	13.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent Events
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Assets Held for Sale
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In January 2016 the Company entered into an agreement to sell
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	unoccupied buildings and land on its campus in Fitchburg, Massachusetts.&nbsp;&nbsp;These assets have been classified as Assets Held for Sale at December 31, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The carrying value of the properties approximates the fair value less the cost to sell.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company expects the sale of the properties to be completed by the e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	nd of 2016 and does not expect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	any material impact on the statement of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	Appointment of Director
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	February 1, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the Company's Board of Directors appointed Mr.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Bryan S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Ganz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a director of the Company,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;

	effective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

	background can be found in the Current Report on Form 8-K filed on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	February 5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.

</P>

</TD>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:8PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on our evaluation;
</FONT>
</P>

</TR>

	disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal controls over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal controls over financial reporting; and
